comment: The first person diagnosed with coronavirus in London turned up unannounced at a hospital in an Uber taxi after falling ill. She  went straight to the A&E reception desk to report her symptoms  both clear breaches of guidance aimed at stopping the spread of the virus. - Guardian

@bryanjamesUK Your tweet comes across accusational and as though the Chinese patient is irrelevant and has somehow deliberately infected other people.They got a taxi rather than a bus or train, they went to A&E rather than local GP surgery. Sounds sensible to me.

@GillJeffery13 Public Health England advice is to stay indoors and call NHS 111, even if symptoms are mild. You should avoid all public transport and taxis to limit the potential spread of infection.https://t.co/kTZ8VSnnYj
